== Third Part Software ==

TwoUse toolkit contains customized parts of the following software:
 * [http://perso.univ-lr.fr/ghillair/projects.html OWL1 Metamodel] by [http://perso.univ-lr.fr/ghillair/ Guillaume Hillairet]
 * [http://ontoware.org/projects/owlodm/ OWL-ODM ] by Peter Haase et al.
 * [http://www.uni-koblenz-landau.de/koblenz/fb4/institute/IFI/AGStaab/Research/koblenz/fb4/institute/IFI/AGStaab/Research/systeme/SAIQL SAIQL] by Noam Bercovici
 * [http://www.aifb.uni-karlsruhe.de/WBS/sbr/publications/odmrules.pdf UML Profile for SWRL by Saartje Brockmans et al].
 * OWL icons of [http://protege.stanford.edu/ Protégé Ontology Editor]

TwoUse toolkit uses the following third-part software:
 * [http://clarkparsia.com/pellet/ Pellet Reasoner]
 * [http://emftext.org/ EMFText]
 * [http://owlapi.sourceforge.net/ OWL API]
 * [http://jena.sourceforge.net/ontology/ Jena Ontology API]

TwoUse toolkit recommends the following third-part software:
 * [http://www.topcased.org/ TopCased UML Editor]

== Standards ==

TwoUse toolkit implements the following standards: 

 * [http://www.omg.org/spec/ODM/ OMG ontology Definition Metamodel (ODM)] Version 1.0
 * [http://www.w3.org/TR/owl2-syntax/ OWL 2 Web Ontology Language Structural Specification and Functional-Style Syntax] W3C Recommendation 27 October 2009
 * [http://www.w3.org/TR/rdf-sparql-query/ SPARQL Query Language for RDF] W3C Recommendation 15 January 2008
 * [http://www.w3.org/Submission/SWRL/ SWRL: A Semantic Web Rule Language Combining OWL and RuleML] W3C Member Submission 21 May 2004
